Description: Neck sherd of East Greek (North Ionian) black-figured pottery krater; interior: upper part glazed with added red band lined in white; exterior slipped cream: in neck panel part of a roughly drawn siren (?) to left; filling ornaments: blobs; red paint on wing of siren and incision for details; corner of panel on shoulder preserved below.
Dimensions: Diameter: 25 centimetres (circa, at base of neck)
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.550)
